intro: Plagiobothrys arizonicus, commonly known as Arizona thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, thimble-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Plagiobothrys arizonicus is an important plant for local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
